topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557a759163687219f8001aff#post_557a759163687219f8001aff
well i for one prefer having a controller in my hand and graphics/processing power doesn't mean shit to me

however as much as i'd like to say that consoles are for games and should stick to what they do best and provide the best experience with they've degraded into more accessible machines that  let you watch your gay chinese cartoons and kind of put more emphasis on that than games (lookin at you microsoft)

im probably not up to date to have any real opinion on the matter, but i'd like consoles to be what they were in the past rather than having to worry about the future. though ofc that isnt happening so it looks like im gunna better off just playing games on my pc with the graphics turned lower than necessary like i always do instead of worrying about the future of consoles

topics.author: 50a843d47f123b2e7c001359

topics.body:
"@hype":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557a77df6368722b7e000b6e#post_557a77df6368722b7e000b6e
You know what I legitimately hate about consoles?

How they "ask kindly" crossplatform games to downgrade their graphics so that they can claim to have better graphics than pc.  I'm not going to lie; I will dance on the grave of console gaming because at this point all they're doing is holding back gaming by forcing crossplatform games to graphically downgrade so that pc versions don't look better.  That kind of shit has to stop.

Reason why I hate consoles:
Microsoft/Sony, "If you want to sell your games on our console you have to reduce the graphics; if you don't we won't allow your game".
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557a7a3863687219f8002691#post_557a7a3863687219f8002691
i just wish that people didn't care so much about how a game looks, i feel that would solve a lot of problems with the markets today

it really shouldnt matter how much polish a game has as long as it's fun. that's the philosophy that kept me playing the ps1 and sixth gen consoles when the seventh was in its prime, and i'm perfectly content with playing games such as new vegas many years after their release

in fact i'm a little apprehensive about fallout 4 simply because it's not going to be released in the seventh gen era, it's something new that i wanna check out yeah but it's also something i'm not exactly prepared for (monatarily) if it turns out to be monolithic in the graphics department

it is stupid that sony and microsoft have to do shit like that though, having a disadvantage in one department doesn't mean that the whole game isn't worth the buy - especially if a lot of people don't have a computer that can exceed the console's power

it still amazes me how popular tablets are even though they can do next to jack shit

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557a7a3863687219f8002691#post_557a7a3863687219f8002691
Over a decade ago, I thought that the focus on graphics will come to an end, when they are nearly realistic. And I was horribly wrong.

In a way, it's impressive that gamers still insist on being graphic whores, when the difference is between nearly realistic and a bit more nearly realistic. By now, it's as if you go buy something that cost around $1000, but complain that it costs five cent more than in another store.

Really impressive. In the same way it's impressive that CWC is still alive.
